content.description:
Yellowfoot is the first route that you see upon following the path the The Johnny Cash Boulders, and is distinct from other routes on the rock by the large 24" wide ledge in the middle of the route.

The route starts below a giant ledge that once held a giant block on two jugs.  Head up into the block, up and through to the giant sloper of a face that's above.
content.protection: A couple of pads below would be wise.

content.description: Start on excellent sit start choices and move either up and right or straight up the arete.
content.location: Obvious boulder on the hill above the other Johnny Cash boulders. Slanted landing so a cleverly placed log or two could benefit this spot. Also, there is a tree that interrupts the topout, so use it if you get a little thrutchy instead of making your buddy catch you!

content.description: Start on the slab shelf and move directly up the arete on decent holds to a sloper top out. Hold it together on the top out or risk taking a fall into the pit beneath the climb.
content.location: Large boulder on your right while walking up to the johnny cash boulders. Can be seen across from yellowfoot.

climbs.name: The Mud & the Blood & the Beer

content.description: Shares the same sit start as Johnny Cash, instead, immediately move left to balance the left hand jug-throw.
Start as for Johnny Cash but Dyno from the volume hold to the jug! The sloper pocket is off. Easier if you're tall
Sit start with a left handful and a right hand sloper above your head. Move up and right along the obvious line. Stellar sandstone.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter to keep your head off of the rocks.
content.location: Coming up the trail you can either take a right to Yellowfoot, or a left to Johnny Cash. Either way, the trails connect into a nice circle around the two close proximity boulders.

content.description: Open arms and hands style your way up the arete/face to the juggy topout.
content.protection: Spot and pads. Or just dial it in:)
content.location: Right Arete of the higher boulder.

content.description: Popular problem. Yellowfoot (area) sit-start that moves right, then up over the excellent obvious slapper.
content.protection: This one can be done without a pad.
